author: Special Correspondent
text:
Taking suo motu cognisance of media reports on the rescue of about 550 bonded labourers from Odisha and Chhattisgarh from a brick kiln in Tiruvallur, the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has issued a notice to the State government calling for a report.

Citing media reports on the inhuman working conditions of the labourers, an official release stated, “The Commission has observed that the contents of the reports, if true, raise a serious issue of violation of human rights of the victim labourers.”

A notice has been issued to the Secretary of the Labour Department calling for a factual report within two weeks and the authority has also been asked to specify the steps taken for rehabilitation of the labourers as well as details of the payment made to the labourers on their release, it added. According to media reports, the labourers were made to work from 3 am for a meagre weekly wages of Rs. 400 a family.
title: NHRC notice to State on rescued bonded labourers
